data.title: ManageEngine NetFlow Analyzer vs Paessler PRTG
data.meta_description: Are you looking for a simple network traffic analysis and bandwidth management tool? Learn more about how ManageEngine NetFlow Analyzer is a best alternative to Paessler PRTG.
data.text:
ManageEngine NetFlow Analyzer - Bandwidth management made easy

NetFlow Analyzer is a standalone, comprehensive, flow-based, highly scalable bandwidth monitoring and network traffic analysis tool that helps you gain in-depth visibility into your network devices, interfaces, apps, conversations, bandwidth usage, and network traffic. Part of the ManageEngine ITOM suite, it monitors all major devices and flow formats such as NetFlow, sFlow, jFlow, IPFIX, and AppFlow, collecting and converting it into meaningful information that help the IT administrators achieve the best performance out of your networks.

Here are a few of our standout features:

Built-in templates to export network flows from the GUI.

Supports all major flow formats and offers multi-vendor support and transparent pricing.

Security analytics reporting with network anomaly detection with the Advanced Security Analytics Module (ASAM) and forensic reporting.

Monitors devices that don't support flow with NetFlow Generator.

Bandwidth forecasting, capacity planning, and usage based billing reports for charge back.

Customizable reports for better visibility of conversation-level details.

Detailed AVC, AS view, and WAAS reports.

Medianet, Multicast, IP SLA, and Wireless LAN monitoring.

Integrates seamlessly with applications performance management, Network Configuration Management, and IP address and switch port management solutions, and ManageEngine ServiceDesk Plus and ServiceNow to create custom alerts and notification templates.

Ability to monitor and manage Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources and virtual private clouds (VPCs) in your network.

Licensing - ManageEngine NetFlow Analyzer vs. PRTG Network Monitor

NetFlow Analyzer provides an interface-based licensing model that starts at $595 for 10 interfaces. PRTG Network Monitor follows an aspect-based licensing model where one aspect equals one interface/device. PRTG Network Monitor base pricing starts at $1,750 per server installation which can monitor up to 500 aspects of your devices in your network, the equivalent of about 50 devices.
